message.content: This question requires some understanding of the role of sunlight in vitamin D synthesis and the concept of alternative sources of vitamin D. Vitamin D is synthesized in the skin when it is exposed to sunlight. However, for a person with a vitamin D deficiency who is allergic to sunlight, they cannot rely on sunlight for vitamin D production. Therefore, the best alternative source of vitamin D would be through their diet. Option (D), eating more cheese, is a good choice as cheese is a dietary source of vitamin D. Option (A), looking at pictures, is not a viable solution as it does not provide any vitamin D. Option (B), drinking more water, and option (C), bathing more often, are unrelated to the synthesis or intake of vitamin D.

This question requires basic knowledge about vitamin D and sunlight. Vitamin D can be obtained through exposure to sunlight, so if a person is allergic to sunlight, they may have a vitamin D deficiency. In this case, the person could eat more cheese as it is a dietary source of vitamin D. Option (A) is incorrect because looking at pictures does not provide vitamin D. Option (B) is unrelated to the problem and does not address the deficiency. Option (C) is also unrelated to the problem and does not provide vitamin D.
